inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of a pituitary adenoma requiring resection defined as pituitary lesion with any of the following:
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Neuroimaging or clinical evidence of apoplexy
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Decline in central visual acuity worse than (best-corrected) Snellen equivalent of 20/25 in either eye
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Clinically significant visual field loss as determined by Humphrey or Goldmann perimetry
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Severe medical co-morbidities with the inability to undergo general anesthesia
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a known case of Acromegaly who underwent transsphenoidal surgery 4 months ago. He has residual pituitary tumor and takes only vitamin D and multivitamins.
